title: Newt Serif released with Veer
content:
Hi! How's it going! I'm excited. Because my first font [is now on the market](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016235428/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=Newt%20Serif&producttype=TYP%2CIMG%2CILL) with Veer!

I developed Newt Serif with the help of the Typophile Critique forum ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016235428/http:/www.typophile.com/salamander)). After a long time, it's finally come to fruition. The character set includes Basic Latin, Latin-1, and Latin Extended-A codepages, along with a few other characters here and there. There are four weights -- Light, Regular, Demi, and Bold, each with an italic. Thanks for the help, everyone! I hope you like it.
author: Number3Pencils

comments.content:
The results are quite charming!  
Many congrats, and may it bring you some bacon.

hhp

Well done! I really like it. As Hrant says, it is charming.

It's great to see a font go right from start to finish here on Typophile.
Congratulations, its good to see all that hard work rewarded. Well done and I hope its a great success.
Cool typeface! I like the strong calligraphic touch. Keep up the good work.

Thanks, everyone.

<cite>Many congrats, and may it bring you some bacon.</cite>

Mmm... what more could I ask from my font?

\>\> Many congrats, and may it bring you some bacon.  
\>\>  
\>\> _Mmm... what more could I ask from my font?_

Side orders of eggs and hash browns, maybe, plus toast and black coffee? ;)

Congratulations, Nathanael.
